notes.quote: Honesty requires that we each radically reduce our expectations that machines will do our work for us or that therapists can make us learned or healthy.
notes.author: Ivan Illich
notes.notes: I spent my 20s accumulating stuff, habit, money. Entering my 30s I came to realize that a bit of that wisdom that come with aging is about unlearning certain behavior and expectations. The value of putting the work, examining yourselfs becaome more real but also easier to ignore or escape over time. You can't beat entropy, even if technology makes you think you can.

notes.quote: There is no product or service more ecological, sustainable and recyclable as the one we do not use.
notes.author: Philippe Bihouix
notes.notes: In a time where we all seem to struggle to find truly sustainable solutions we tend to forget that not doing, producing, making, buying is the most relevent path. The oxymoronic nature of this is a necessary acknowledgment in a world obsessed about growth. May this be a helpful way to remember that not doing is always the cheapest and often the truly virtuous path.

notes.quote: The main distinction between meditation and our usual hap hazard thinking is coherence; it should be an ascetical exercise of intellectual sobriety.
notes.author: Anthony bloom
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: The man is richest whose pleasure are cheapest
notes.author: Thoreau
notes.notes: I found too much peace in letting go of many physical things to not agree with this timeless observation. Whether it's appreciating the taste of an boiled egg, the feeling of a pencil or a nap; there seem to be a relationship between the nature of a pleasure and the it's ability to connect us with a sense of presence on one's life.

notes.quote: Sometimes you don't know the value of a moment until it becomes a memory
notes.author: Gunnar Freyr
notes.notes: Building a relationship with my wife and telling stories of my childhood has crystalized this simple fact of life. As I'm thinking of my own future child, I realize that a lot of his worldview will be through his memories - all of them.

notes.quote: The plural of anecdote is data.
notes.author: George J. Stigler
notes.notes: I've spent a few years obsessing over data. Personal tracking, work metrics, studies... The need to test and prove is real and understandable but generally has too high of a cost for the insight it brings. I should not have needed a wearable to tell me the value of sleep. An honest conversation should have been enough.

notes.quote: Like our stomachs, our minds are hurt more often by overeating than by hunger.
notes.author: Petrarch
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: Most tools are boring, until they’re not, and then they become miraculous. The onus is on the craftsperson to figure out how to escape the boredom.
notes.author: Craig Mod
notes.notes: I design websites. Nothing exciting in itself by now. My only real interest in this craft if to create that little touch that will make an experience standout without overdoing it. Tempering the ego to let work be work is has been hard. A good tool often looks beautifully boring. It's a process, both on the creation and relationship side.

notes.quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself—and you are the easiest person to fool.
notes.author: Richard Feynman
notes.notes: I'm just another fool. All of us live knowing this. Few are able keep this as a mantra. I get caught up too often.

notes.quote: The ones who will be able to afford the autonomous car, are already sitting in the back seat.
notes.author: Carlos Tavares
notes.notes: Sometimes I believe in the power of individuals. Because our actions compound we get to all shape the world right? Nope – Decisions trickle down most of the time.

notes.quote: Communication is limited by perspective.
notes.author: Andrei Tarkovsky
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: The learning of many things doesn't teach understanding of anything.
notes.author: Heraclitus
notes.notes: Too many overeducted people have stated the relative futility of their education.

notes.quote: The defenders of our freedom have failed to take into account our Infinite appetite for distraction.
notes.author: Aldous Huxley
notes.notes: Our current liberal democracies can't keep their integrity because we've all lost most of our attention span, thus most of critical thinking.

notes.quote: Wisdom lies in correctly discerning where we are free to mold reality to our desires and where we must accept the unaltered with tranquility.
notes.author: Seneca
notes.notes: Human have clearly overstepped the boundaries of what stoic would have called reasonalble. Nature is not here to please us and we should not always bend it to our desires. Don't build a house at the feet of volcano.

notes.quote: Democracy has no capability to prevent its development towards totalitarism when resources become scarce.
notes.author: Lasse Norlund
notes.notes: The concept of post scarcity annoys me as it feels so detached from reality. There is too many things not working in our current system to be that delusional. We all need food, water and shelter. The condition for widespread access to this is a precarious balance.

notes.quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
notes.author: Lao Tzu
notes.notes: Gardening taught me something beyond patience. An acknowledgment of the perfection i

notes.quote: Everything has been said before, but since nobody listens we have to keep going back and beginning all over again.
notes.author: André Gide
notes.notes: I started this collection to solve exaclty this. Everything as been said before, better than I could say it. I tried many time to give my own free thinking some space and envergy but ended up with mediocre notes that can often be summarize in few words - hence this.

notes.quote: I don't like training but I don't like dying either, so I'm going to train.
notes.author: Beau Miles
notes.notes: Discipline should have a purpose. Training certainly has one. All essentials practices can be and should be considered training. From the obvious physical ones to the more subtles ones, like boredom.

notes.quote: There is meaning and satisfaction in living close to the source of things.
notes.author: Masanobu Fukuoka
notes.notes: We are so removed from the orgini of most things that populate our lives. Objects manufactured on the other side of the world, plants cultivated hundreds of miles away. The concept of autonomy start by getting physically closer to things to change our relationship the the processes and resources amking our lives what they are.

notes.quote: We should not attribute to malice that which is more easily explained by stupidity.
notes.author: Hanlon's razor
notes.notes: It took me too long time to properly use and understand this popular adage. Often used as a convenient intelectual shortcut to avoid having to really make an effort to thinking critically.

notes.quote: All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone
notes.author: Blaise Pascal
notes.notes: One thought to rule them all. The ability to not think as the ultimate skill for healthy function.

notes.quote: Beware the stories you read or tell; subtly, at night, beneath the waters of consciousness, they are altering your world.
notes.author: Ben Okri
notes.notes: Everything is a constructed story. We're here today thanks to them but also miserable because of them. They should be seen for what they are, devices. Not realities.

notes.quote: The part can never be well unless the whole is well.
notes.author: Plato
notes.notes: It's easy to fall for incremetnal gain but leave the root cause be. The bigness argument always surface. Sometimes allegedly. Often as rejection of the true origin.

notes.quote: He who jumps into the void owes no explanation to those who stand and watch.
notes.author: Jean-Luc Godard
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: Don't like trucks? Stop buying shit! Problem solved
notes.author: Bumper sticker on the I5
notes.notes: Consumerism is not easy to bear. it's waste is in our face allt eh time. We tend to grow numb to it. I can't stand the diffuse sound to the distant freeway in the night. It reminds me too much of my lack of autonomy.

notes.quote: The essence of greatness is the perception that virtue is enough.
notes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
notes.notes: There is much else we can aspire to in life. DO the right thing and derive from our action the feeling of having done our part.

notes.quote: Their mistakes did more of the teaching than the explicit virtues they were trying to instill in me.
notes.author: Sharon
notes.notes: Learning something sometimes often happens in very inderct ways. Observing these way teaches us as much as the lessons themselves.

notes.quote: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death
notes.author: Leonardo da Vinci
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: There is a beauty and clarity that comes from simplicity that we sometimes do not appreciate in our thirst for intricate solutions
notes.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: If hard work made us rich, donkeys would be draped in gold
notes.author: Heard Craig say this
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: Conquer without struggle and you will succeed without glory
notes.author: Corneille
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: Find a thing, get good at it, get paid for it - and only then, focus on your passion
notes.author: Robbie
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: For me, letting go actually translated into getting control - The law of the universe at play.
notes.author: Thomas
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: Oh dear, I really ought to do something. But I'm already in my pyjamas.
notes.author: My roommate in the Tenderloin
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: It’s when you look for meaning that you get confused.
notes.author: C. Bukowski
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know
notes.author: Pema Chödrön
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: Design should be like vanilla ice cream: simple and sweet, plain without being austere.
notes.author: Franc Chimero
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: You can’t make someone act right but you can make him wish he did
notes.author: A lady that lives on a boat docked in Sausalito
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: If you can't tell if this is terrible or great. That’s probably a sign you shouldn’t do it.
notes.author: Repeated by Romain
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: True Elegance is knowing what to say and when to say it
notes.author: Heard in a Nob Hill restaurant
notes.notes: Hmmm

notes.quote: If traveling was free, you'd never see me again
notes.author: Anthony, Startup employee
notes.notes: I heard too many people say that they wouldn't kno what to do with themselves if they got rich or the chance to retire early. Beyond traveling, I would certainly not have this issue. I'm interested in too many things to not know what to do beyond capital producing work.

notes.quote: I do it for the memories.
notes.author: Sasha in SoMa
notes.notes: The why of certain action should be considered beyond rational and pragmatic thought.

notes.quote: The more you know, the less you need
notes.author: A design book I flipped through
notes.notes: People say oddly inspiring things while looking at art.

notes.quote: I learn everyday to allow the space between where I want to be and where I am to inspire me and not terrify me
notes.author: Ichika while visiting SF MoMa
notes.notes: People say oddly inspiring things while looking at art.

notes.quote: It's okay to love something a little too much, as long as it's real to you
notes.author: Jeffrey Ismael
notes.notes: Reminded me of Bukowski without the usual booze or self destruction reference

notes.quote: It's nice to know that everyone else is a mess as well
notes.author: A guy a met in Party in Nob Hill
notes.notes: Random encouters

notes.quote: Sometimes you are so far behind, you'd think you are first
notes.author: Mimosa dean
notes.notes: Thoughts about blindspots

notes.quote:
Be nice.
Be useful.
Bring wine.
notes.author: My chinese roommate
notes.notes: Not sure here

notes.quote: The next big thing will be a lot of small things.
notes.author: A wall in Mission District
notes.notes: Lot's to say about this one

notes.quote: You don’t get to decide the truth. Life is big—much bigger than just yours.
notes.author: Franck Chimero
notes.notes: Wisdom from Franck
